x {
x
Basic Infantry Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Improved Infantry Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Standardised Infantry Equipment
Standardising the production output of our weapon and arour smiths will make their production more efficient.
Advanced Infantry Weapons
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Competition Infantry
Tournaments have held competitions for infantry since men first equipped clubs. Melees were held, either with two competitors or a whole group, with the winners rewarded handsomely.
Elite Infantry Weapons
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Supreme Infantry Weapons
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Basic Archer Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Short Bows
The simple bow is a omnipresent tool in society with vast military potential.
Improved Archer Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Recurve Bows
With limbs that curve, a recurve bow stores more energy and transfers energy more efficiently to arrows than straight bows.
Barbed Arrows
Barbed arrows cut into the flesh and lacerate the skin, causing increased pain and bleeding to the victim pincushion.
Standrdised Archery Equipment
Standardising the production output of our fletchers will make their production more efficient.
Advanced Archer Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Long Bows
Longer and bigger bows enable greater force to be stored in the bow when drawing the bowstring, and thus greater power to be transferred to the arrow.
Competition Archery
Tournaments have held competitions for archers since time the bow was first picked up. Bowmen with the best accuracy against targets were often rewarded lavishly.
Elite Archer Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Composite Bows

As a devlopment of recurve bows, composite bows utilise two distinct materials in their construction, usually wood and horn. As the bowstring is drawn and stretched, and the horn on the bow is compressed, meaning greater energy can be stored in the bow and transferred to the arrow on release
Bodkin Arrows
Bodkin pointed arrows are a relatively simple squared metal spike designed primarily to pierce through mail armour, making them more effective against well-equipped foes.
Supreme Archer Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
War Bows
War Bows are the peak evolution of long bow development.
War Arrows
The pinnacle of arrow design and innovation.
Fire Arrows
Specialised arrows can be opportunistically used to wreck havoc when sieging enemy fortresses
Basic Rider Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Animal Husbandry
The use of pack and draft animals will make our farms significantly more efficient.
Improved Rider Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Standardised Horse Rearing
Standardising the kinds of horses, whether they be destriers or coursers, that our farmers are producing will make the production more efficient.
Advanced Rider Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Outriders
The forward soldiers of an army, outriders perform key operations primarily as scouts and messangers.
Competition Cavalry

Tournaments have held competitions for cavalry since man first rode. Jousts, pitting the finest horsemen against either other in fierce and deadly combat, were fought, with the winners rewarded handsomely.
Elite Rider Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Nomad Bows
A type of recurve bow, the nomad bow has been made specifically for horse archers - it is purposefully designed to be small, but powerful and accurate.
Supreme Rider Equipment
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Scout Waystations

Sometimes, messages are too important to stop to rest, and horses to not have the strength to continue riding. By establishing a series of waystations, scouts and messangers can switch their horses for a fresh one to avoid resting.
Maeras Riders

The Maeras are the horses descended from Felar√≥f, one of the horses of Eorl, the first King of Rohan. These horses are bred specifically for their size, speed and strength, and bear none other than the royalty of the Mark.
Basic Artillery Construction
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Improved Artillery Construction
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Standardised Artillery Construction
Standardising the production output of our artillery craftsmen will make their production more efficient.
Advanced Artillery Construction
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Competition Artillery
Engineering achievements must be rewarded and thus tournaments for the finest siege engines must be held to reward those in our service.
Elite Artillery Construction
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
Supreme Artillery Construction
Despite having recently developed new equipment for our army, it takes some time to craft and deploy the equipment.
x }
x {
x
Caltrops
Spiked, area of denial weapons, caltrops are often scattered in front of defensive lines and choke points to slow enemy movement
Archer Towers
Archers manning towers may put them at higher risk, but their aim will not be truer
Flaming Bolts
Great balls of file that generally are used as fire ammunition on siege engines or as a method of using gravity against advancing enemies.
Boiling Tar
Battering ram approaching the gate and don't have a way to set it on fire? No problem! Just pour some tar over those manning the ram...
Archer's Stake
Wood sharpened into stakes, these were generally placed in front of archers to deter cavalry charges.
Chevaux de Frise
a defensive obstacle consisting of a portable frame, often a log, studded with spikes used to restrict enemy movement
Field Fortifications
As we have tested various defensive positions, we have discovered ways to quickly set up adhoc fortifications in the field
Menelmacar
Menelmacar, the Swordsman of the Sky, is one of the constellations of Arda
Forced March
Sometimes the army needs to be somewhere that it cannot reasonably travel in a day. Luckily, that time suck known as sleep isn't required...
Focused Attacks
By targeting one position and breaking it, we can gain an advantage over our enemies in a given battle.
Mountain Hordes

The Northern Goblins have never been known to deploy well trained, or even heavily armored troops. In fact, the one thing that they're known for is having endless hordes descending from the mountains.
Rapid Deployment
The faster our troops get into position, the sooner the battle can begin.
Banners of Command
In the midst of combat, many times verbal commands cannot be heard, or are missed. Banners signifying different commands can overcome these liabilities.
Battlefied Mobility
Troops commonly are in the wrong position to be effective. By quickly moving troops around as needed, we can ensure that our enemy breaks before we do.
Rally Points
After combat, troops need to be reorganized. By establishing rally points, we can more quickly accomplish that.
Eagles

From Tolkien Gateway:\n\n"Eagles, also known as Great Eagles, were immense, sentient birds that served as messengers of Manw√´. They were capable of speech and often helped Men, Elves and Wizards in their efforts to defeat foes such as Morgoth and Sauron."
Fellbeasts

From Tolkien Gateway:\n\n"Fell beasts were huge winged creatures with a beak and claws and were described as similar to carrion birds but much greater and more monstrous than any kind of bird, including Eagles. They were dark and appeared shadow-like even at night. Their body was plain and naked, lacking any quills or feathers. They had a long neck as well as vast pinions consisting of a web-like "hide between horned fingers". They possessed a "fell speed" which allowed them to fly faster than the wind. Furthermore, fell beasts also gave off a stench. In battle they swooped upon prey with their feet to drop foes from the sky, crushed enemies under their sheer weight, and used their vast wings to blow foul gusts of wind."
Air-to-air combat
Our enemy's aerial support can now be countered.
Soron√∫m√´
Soron√∫m√´, the Eagle of the West, is one of the constellations of Arda
Minasdirith

The Minasdirath, otherwise known as the Order of the Guard, is a military order that all beacon guards belong to. Besides remaining vigilant and protecting/lighting beacons, members of the Minasdirath also conscripts young men from nearby villages and trains them to be beacon-guards to help ease up on Gondor's soldier shortage.
Militias
Conscripts pressed into service, militias lack many of the skills of a standing army. However, by employing militias, we can ensure that our troops have more training should we need to go to war.
Ents
The Ents march to war! Rather than wielding any weapons, they themselves are the weapons.
Eagles (Unit)
The Eagles fly to war! Rather than wielding any weapons, that themselves are the weapons.
Spiders
The Spiders march to war! Rather than wielding any weapons, that themselves are the weapons.
M√ªmakil
The M√ªmakil march to war! Specifically trained for combat by the Haradrim, these great beasts are mounted by a battalion of men upon platforms on their backs.
Barrow-wights
Sent to the Barrow-downs by the Witch-king of Angmar, the Barrow-wights inhabit the bodies of those entombed within the barrows. They then use those bodies to feed on living creatures in the area.
Marsh-wights
The Marsh-wights are wights sent to Gramavuld by the Witch-king of Angmar following the slaying of Smaug. They live within the Long Marshes, and prey on travellors to boost their numbers.
Oathbreakers

Formerly the Men of the Mountain, the Oathbreakers swore allegience to Isildur should Gondor go to war with Sauron. When they were called upon to honor the call to arms, they instead forsake their oath, and slowly began to fade, doomed to become undead roaming the White Mountains in the Paths of the Dead.
Lance Retinues
Soldiers serving a knight, lance retinues remain the core of our standing armies.
Basic Training
All soldiers need training before they can join the army. Basic training ensures that soldiers understand just that, the basics.
Snaga Skirmishers
By arming our militias with javelins, we can press our numbers advantage.
Skinchangers
A waning race of Men, Skinchangers are those who are able to wildshape into an animal. Generally taking the form of a bear, skinchangers are a boon in any battle.
Berserkers

Offensive infantry leading the charge, Berserkers are lightly armored and wielding two-handed weapons, fantastic for thinning the front line to allow the mainline infantry to exploit gaps in the enemy line.
Raiders

Driven from their homeland, the Wildmen have learned to eke a living off of rocks. During harder seasons, there are not enough resources to sustain their peoples, driving the various tribes to raid their neighbors.
Elvenking's Guard
The most elite warriors of the Woodland Realm, the Elvenking's Guard's sole job is to protect the royal line.
Darkblades
The elite vanguard of the Angmarrim armies, Darkblades function as the advance scouts of Angmar, ironically mimicking the abilities of their sworn enemy, the Northern D√∫nedain.
Moriquendi Shadows

The Moriquendi are the elves who refused to undertake the great journey to Valinor. They instead chose to fully remain in Middle-earth, and became some of the first targets of Morgoth for corruption. Depending on the tale of the creation of the Orcs, some of the more unlucky Avari may have been transformed into the first Orcs. The shadows are those who have learned to pass without trace, even within the heartlands of the Enemy.
Adhalling Rangers
Living along the northeastern Eaves of Mirkwood, the Adhallings have learned to use the terrain to their advantage.
Shirriffs
The law enforcement of the Shire, the Shirriffs protect the Shire from both troublesome Hobbitses and outside threats.
Snow Rangers
Protectors and hunters of the north, the Snow Rangers of the Lossoth both protect their tribe and scout out the Enemy.
D√∫nedain Rangers
Descendents of the people of Arnor, the D√∫nedain have sworn an oath to protect the Free Peoples of Eriador. The range among the Wild of Eriador, eliminating servants of the Dark Lord.
Ithilien Rangers
Scouts, warriors and the descendents of the Gondorian of Ithilien, the Ithilien Rangers harass the servants of Mordor throughout the region.
Marchwardens of Lothl√≥rien
Protectors of the woods of Lothl√≥rien, the Marchwardens defend the forest from any threat.
Skirmishers
Javelinmen of the Middle Men, these men throw javelin before charging into melee.
Eldarinw√´ Archers
With hundreds of years of training and experience, the Eldarinw√´ Archers are the best of the best of the √ëoldor archers.
Black Arrow Guildsmen
The guardsmen of Esgaroth and Dale, the Black Arrow Guildsmen train to prevent the next threat to the great cities of Gramavuld.
Bandobras Archers
Hobbits generally are not considered great warriors. However, their stout courage and better-than-average aim makes them excellent archers.
Dwarven Catapults
Dwarven catapults are sturdier and more flexible than those of the other Free People's.
Troll Catapults
Standard artillery manned by Trolls, Troll Catapults are one of the strengths of the Servants of Sauron.
Swan Knights
The retinue of the Princes of Dol Amroth, the Swan Knights are the best trained knights in Gondor.
Serpent Guards
The guards of the leader of Harad, the Serpent Guard are willing to lay down their lives to protect their lord.
Variag Riders
Living up to their ancestors, the Variags of Khand are master horsemen, dominating any battlefield.
L√¥ke-Innas Rim
The heavy cavalry of the East, the L√¥ke-Innas Rim dominate all battlefields.
Riders of Rohirrim
The descendents, both literally and figuratively, the Rohirrim inherited the riding traditions of their ancestors from Rhovanion.
Rhovanion Riders
The predecessors to the Rohirrim, the men of Rhovanion have a history of riding and leading their armies to victory throughout the Third Age.
Riders of Imladris
The elven rangers from Imladris, the fierce horse archers from the refuge rarely miss.
Variag Riders
Living up to their ancestors, the Variags of Khand are master horsemen, dominating any battlefield.
Vinter Guard
Riders armed with crossbows, the Vinter Guard protected the vinelands of Dorwinion.
√âored Skirmishers
Armed with bows, the horse archers of Rohan extend the riding tradition of the realm with their bows.
D√∫nedain Wardens
Descendents of the people of Arnor, the D√∫nedain have sworn an oath to protect the Free Peoples of Eriador. The range among the Wild of Eriador, eliminating servants of the Dark Lord.
Lindon Longspears
Protectors of Lindon, the Lindon Longspears boast some of the longest pikes in Middle-earth.
Orthanc Guards
Defenders of the Tower of Orthanc, the Orthanc guard are the only organization in the West boasting pikes as long as those from Lindon.
Greenward Guards
An organization dating back to the days of Arnor, the Greenway Guards protect the Greenway throughout Eriador.
Moriqueni Defenders

The Moriquendi are the elves who refused to undertake the great journey to Valinor. They instead chose to fully remain in Middle-earth, and became some of the first targets of Morgoth for corruption. Depending on the tale of the creation of the Orcs, some of the more unlucky Avari may have been transformed into the first Orcs. The defenders are those who have become protectors of their people, fully knowing the threat that the Great Evil presents.
Corsairs
Elite infantry trained as the marines of Umbar, the Corsairs are fearsome both on the water, and on land.
L√¥ke-Gamp Rim
The mainline infantry of the Men of the East, the L√¥ke-Gamp Rim boast golden armor and shining arms to fight their enemies.
Dain's Guard
The most elite Dwarven warriors, Dain's Guard protect the King of Erebor with their lives.
Woodsmen Warriors
Armed with axes and greataxes, the Woodsmen of Rhovanion are willing to defend their villages to the bitter end.
Morgul Uruks
The most elite of Sauron's forces, the Morgul Uruks have trained under the personal supervision of the Witch-king of Angmar.
Guldur Uruks
The most elite of Sauron's forces, the Morgul Uruks have trained under the personal supervision of Kham√ªl the Easterling.
Moria Deep-dwellers
Highly trained infantry from Moria, the Moria Deep-dwellers erupt from the black pit to challenge those around the Vale of Anduin and Eriador.
Witch-knights
The most elite forces of Angmar, the Witch-knights continue the proud elite tradition of the Men of Angmar. hoping for the return of their lord and namesake.
Snow Guard
Camp protectors of the Lossoth, the Snow Guard are willing to lay down their lives in service of their people.
Merchant Guard
All travellors should have protection on the roads of Middle-earth, especially those travelling often.
Military Drill
Basic training isn't enough. Our troops need to have reoccurring training to ensure that they retain their skills.
Military Schools
A good army is only as good as its decision makers. By establishing military schools, we can ensure that our leaders and officers understand how to lead.
Discipline
If our troops rout from combat, it doesnt matter how effective they are with a blade.
Outposts
By establishing outposts in border territory, we can better defend out lands.
x }
x {
x
Ramming
Sometimes, the best way to defeat an enemy navy is to sink each ship.
Advanced Ramming
Our engineers and admiralty has developed stronger ships, more easily allowing ramming.
Boarding
Sometimes, the best way to defeat an enemy navy is to board each ship and commandeer it.
Boarding Bridges
Sometimes, ships are too far apart to board easily. By placing a secured plank between two ships, we can more easily board the enemy.
Shipbuilding
Commercial shipbuilding is key to ensuring a strong naval presence.
Corsair Ships
Known for their black sails and ruthless efficiency, the Corsairs of Umbar use their own type of heavy ship to wreak havoc upon their foes.
Grand Shipyards
Large harbors dedicated to ship constructure, allowing allowing more ships to be serviced and built at once.
x }
x {
x
Wilwarin
Wilwarin, the Butterfly, is one of the constellations of Arda
Lembas Bread

From Tolkien Gateway:

"Lembas, Elvish Waybread were very nutritious, stayed fresh for months when wrapped in leaves, and were used for sustenance on long journeys. Lembas had a brownish colour on the outside and a cream colour on the inside.

According to Gimli, it was a food of the same kind as Cram, although one of the Elves of Lothl√≥rien commented that it was more pleasant, and more strengthening than any food made by Men.

Like other products of the Elves, it was offensive to evil creatures
column3: Gollum refused outright to eat of it. When Frodo was captured by Orcs in Mordor, the Orcs hated the look of the lembas even more than Gollum had."

column2: Valacirca
Valacirca, the Sickle of the Valar, is one of the constellations of Arda
Stone Sense
Dwarves have an innate connection with the earth, and with enough practice, can hear the stone singing. These melodies more quickly lead them to ore veins and gemstones.
Fires of Industry
Streamlining guilds into "industries" will undoubtedly yield high outputs over time.
Centers of Trade
Large cities with even larger markets bring merchants from far and wide.
Mobilization Planning
Raising militias is no easy task. Movements need to be coordinated, supplies need to be moved, and rally points need to be deterimed. By making plans ahead of time, we can streamline this process.
Caravans
By moving reinforcements and supplies together in caravans, we can more easily reinforce the front.
Supply Lines
By establishing supply lines, we can ensure that our troops are regularly reinforced and supplied.
Planned Logistics
Before starting an offensive, if we can determine where we will establish supply lines, the better our offensive will perform.
Great Roads
The most well-traversed roads in Middle-Earth are known as "Great Roads". These roads are larger and more well maintained than other roads, allowing more goods to flow across them.
Distribution Channels
By working with guilds directly, we can ensure that military goods are shipped directly to armies.
x }
x {
x
Province Selectors
A debug building that can be built to access the province menu.
Anarr√≠ma
Anarr√≠ma, Sun-border, is one of the constellations of Arda
Houses of Healing

From Tolkien Gateway:

"The Houses of Healing was an infirmary in Minas Tirith.

The Houses were surrounded by lawns and trees, set near to the Citadel-gate and the southward wall in the sixth circle of Minas Tirith. The chief healer was the Warden of the Houses of Healing."
Rationing
By appropriately rationing food, we can ensure that our armies can function even with supply loss.
Breeding Pits
Ashes and dust and thirst there is, and pits, pits, pits. And Orcses, thousands of Orcses.
Inns
Large accommodations for travellors, inns also house regular bards and other entertainment.
x }
x {
x
Athelas
Kingsfoil, aye, it's a weed.\n\nA sweet smelling herb that helps cure wounds and poison.
Orc Draught
Potent and invegorating, Orc Draught gives the drinker a burning sensation to revitalize strength and relieve pain.
Magical Secrets
The world is awash with magical secrets of the past, what is there to discover in the world?
Astronomy

The stars were put in to formations by Varda, "the Firstborn shall come in the darkness, and shall look first upon the stars - to Varda ever shall they call at need". What shall we make of the stars above?
A Lesser Ring

Before Sauron and Celebrimbor forged the One Ring, they created dozens or perhaps hundreds of lesser rings - essays in the craft of ring making to perfect their expertise. Acquiring one of these rings may prove fruitful.
Palantiri

Palantiri, or the Seeing Stones, can be used to communicate instantly across the world. Most of the palantiri are lost, however, and even if we did have access to one, it would be dangerous to use it without knowing where the others were.
Blue Wizards
There were originally fire Istari, Wizards, who came to Middle Earth. The Blue Wizards have not been seen for millenia since they journeyed east.
Entwives
What became of the Entwives?
Another Lesser Ring

Before Sauron and Celebrimbor forged the One Ring, they created dozens or perhaps hundreds of lesser rings - essays in the craft of ring making to perfect their expertise. Acquiring another one of these rings may prove fruitful.
Silmarils

The three greatest gemstones of all time, the three Silmarils are lost - one casted down into the chasms of the earth, one lies at the depth of the ocean, one hangs in the sky as the Star of E√§rendil.
Magical Crafting
With great knowledge of the ancients, we can utilise magical auras and enchant our own artefacts, tools, and weapons.
Enchanted Warriors' Weapons
Our warriors benefit from enchanted weapons and armour.
Enchanted Guildsmen's Tools
Our craftsmen benefit from enchanted tools.
Enchanted Workers' Tools
Our workers benefit from enchanted tools.
Yet another Lesser Ring

Before Sauron and Celebrimbor forged the One Ring, they created dozens or perhaps hundreds of lesser rings - essays in the craft of ring making to perfect their expertise. Acquiring another one of these rings may prove fruitful.
Universities
By establishing higher education for those who can afford it, we can more easily push our realm forward.
x }
x {
x
Telumendil
Telumendil, the Lover of the Heavens, is one of the constellations of Arda
Couriers
What better way to show goodwill to our neighbors than to send couriers with gold and other fine items?
All that is gold does not glitter
All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost. The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
Seek for the Sword that was broken

Seek for the Sword that was broken: In Imladris it dwells. There shall be counsels taken Stronger than Morgul-spells. There shall be shown a token That Doom is near at hand, For Isildur's Bane shall waken, And the Halfling forth shall stand.
Roads go ever ever on

Roads go ever ever on, Over rock and under tree, By caves where never sun has shone, By streams that never find the sea. Over snow by winter sown, And through the merry flowers of June, Over grass and over stone, And under mountains in the moon.
Song of Nimrodel
An Elven-maid there was of old, A shining star by day: Her mantle white was hemmed with gold, Her shoes of silver-grey.
A Walking Song

Upon the hearth the fire is red, Beneath the roof there is a bed. But not yet weary are our feet, Still round the corner we may meet, A sudden tree or standing stone, That none have seen but we alone. Tree and flower and leaf and grass, Let them pass! Let them pass! Hill and water under sky, Pass them by! Pass them by!
The Man in the Moon Stayed Up Too Late
There is an inn, a merry old inn, beneath an old grey hill, And there they brew a beer so brown, That the Man in the Moon himself came down One night to drink his fill.
The Man in the Moon Came Down Too Soon
The Man in the Moon had silver shoon, And his beard was of silver thread
column3: He was girt with pure gold and inaureoled, With gold about his head. Clad in silken robe in his great white globe, He opened an ivory door, With a crystal key, and in secrecy, He stole o'er a shadowy floor.

column2: Ring Verse

Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky, Seven for the Dwarf-lords in their halls of stone, Nine for Mortal Men doomed to die, One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie. One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all, and in the darkness bind them, In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie.
Elven Hymn to Elbereth
Snow-white! Snow-white! O Lady clear! O Queen beyond the Western Seas! O light to us that wander here Amid the world of woven trees!
Ho! Ho! Ho! To the Bottle I Go
Ho! Ho! Ho! to the bottle I go, To heal my heart and drown my woe. Rain may fall and wind may blow, And many miles be still to go, But under a tall tree I will lie, And let the clouds go sailing by.
The Bath Song
Sing hey! for the bath at close of day that washes the weary mud away! A loon is he that will not sing: O! Water Hot is a noble thing!
Farewell We Call to Hearth and Hall!
Farewell we call to hearth and hall! Though wind may blow and rain may fall, We must away ere break of day, Far over wood and mountain tall.
O! Wanderers in the shadowed land

O! Wanderers in the shadowed land despair not! For though dark they stand, all woods there be must end at last, and see the open sun go past: the setting sun, the rising sun, the day's end, or the day begun.
Hey dol! merry dol! ring a dong dillo!
Hey dol! merry dol! ring a dong dillo! Ring a dong! hop along! fal lal the willow! Tom Bom, jolly Tom, Tom Bombadillo!
The Fall of Gil-galad
Gil-galad was an elven-king. Of him the harpers sadly sing
column3: the last whose realm was fair and free between the Mountains and the Sea.

column2: Song of Beren and L√∫thien

The leaves were long, the grass was green, The hemlock-umbels tall and fair, And in the glade a light was seen, Of stars in shadow shimmering. Tin√∫viel was dancing there, To music of a pipe unseen, And light of stars was in her hair, And in her raiment glimmering.
The Stone Troll
Troll sat alone on his seat of stone, And munched and mumbled a bare old bone
column3: For many a year he had gnawed it near, For meat was hard to come by. Done by! Gum by! In a cave in the hills he dwelt alone, And meat was hard to come by.

column2: Song of E√§rendil
E√§rendil was a mariner that tarried in Arvernien
column3: he built a boat of timber felled in Nimbrethil to journey in
column4: her sails he wove of silver fair, of silver were her lanterns made, her prow was fashioned like a swan, and light upon her banners laid.

column2: When winter first begins to bite
When winter first begins to bite and stones crack in the frosty night, when pools are black and trees are bare, 'tis evil in the Wild to fare.
Cold Be Hand and Heart and Bone

Cold be hand and heart and bone, and cold be sleep under stone: never more to wake on stony bed, never, till the Sun fails and the Moon is dead. In the black wind the stars shall die, and still on gold here let them lie, till the dark lord lifts up his hand over dead sea and withered land.
Over the land there lies a long shadow
Over the land there lies a long shadow, westward reaching wings of darkness. The Tower trembles, to the tombs of kings doom approaches. The Dead awaken
column3: for the hour is come for the oathbreakers: at the Stone of Erech they shall stand again and hear there a horn in the hills ringing. Whose shall the horn be? Who shall call them from the grey twilight, the forgotten people? The heir of him to whom the oath they swore. From the North shall he come, need shall drive him: he shall pass the Door to the Paths of the Dead.

column2: When the black breath blows
When the black breath blows and death's shadow grows and all lights pass, come athelas! come athelas! Life to the dying In the king's hand lying!
The Ent and the Entwife

When spring unfolds the beechen-leaf and sap is in the bough, When light is on the wild-wood stream, and wind is on the brow, When stride is long, and breath is deep, and keen the mountain air, Come back to me! Come back to me, and say my land is fair!
Long List of the Ents

Learn now the lore of Living Creatures! First name the four, the free peoples: Eldest of all, the elf-children. Dwarf the delver, dark are his houses. Ent the earthborn, old as mountains. Man the mortal, master of horses.
The Ent's Marching Song
We come, we come with roll of drum: ta-runda runda runda rom! We come, we come with horn and drum: ta-r√Ö¬´na r√Ö¬´na r√Ö¬´na rom!
Bregalad's Song

O Orofarn√´, Lassemista, Carnim√≠ri√´! O rowan fair, upon your hair how white the blossom lay! O rowan mine, I saw you shine upon a summer's day, Your rind so bright, your leaves so light, your voice so cool and soft: Upon your head how golden-red the crown you bore aloft! O rowan dead, upon your head your hair is dry and grey. Your crown is spilled, your voice is stilled for ever and a day. O Orofarn√´, Lassemista, Carnim√≠ri√´!
Arise, arise, Riders of Theoden!

Arise, arise, Riders of Theoden! spear shall be shaken, shield shall be splintered, a sword-day, a red day, ere the sun rises! Ride now, ride now, ride! Ride for ruin and the world's ending! Death! Death! Death! Forth Eorlingas!
Lament for the Rohirrim

Where now the horse and the rider? Where is the horn that was blowing? Where is the helm and the hauberk, and the bright hair flowing? Where is the hand on the harpstring, and the red fire glowing? Where is the spring and the harvest and the tall corn growing? They have passed like rain on the mountain, like a wind in the meadow
column3: The days have gone down in the West behind the hills into shadow. Who shall gather the smoke of the dead wood burning, Or behold the flowing years from the Sea returning?

column2: Biblo's Last Song

Day is ended, dim my eyes, but journey long before me lies. Farewell, friends! I hear the call. The ship's beside the stony wall. Foam is white and waves are grey. Beyond the sunset leads my way. Foam is salt, the wind is free. I hear the rising of the Sea.
Oliphaunt
Grey as a mouse, Big as a house, Nose like a snake, I make the earth shake, As I tramp through the grass
column3: Trees crack as I pass. With horns in my mouth I walk in the South, Flapping big ears. Beyond count of years I stump round and round, Never lie on the ground, Not even to die. Oliphaunt am I, Biggest of all, Huge, old, and tall. If ever you'd meet me, You wouldn't forget me. If you never do, You won't think I'm true
column4: But old Oliphaunt am I, And I never lie.

column2: Into the West
Lay down, Your sweet and weary head, Night is falling, You have come to journey's end
Chip the glasses and crack the plates
Chip the glasses and crack the plates! Blunt the knives and bend the forks! That's what Bilbo Baggins hates!
Far over the misty mountains cold
Far over the misty mountains cold, To dungeons deep and caverns old.
Clap! Snap! The black crack!
Clap! Snap! the black crack! Grip, grab! Pinch, nab! And down down to Goblin-town, You go, my lad!
Fifteen birds in five fir trees

Fifteen birds in five firtrees, their feathers were fanned in a fiery breeze! But, funny little birds, they had no wings! O what shall we do with the funny little things? Roast 'em alive, or stew them in a pot, fry them, boil them and eat them hot? Burn, burn tree and fern! Shrivel and scorch! A fizzling torch To light the night for our delight, Ya hey! Bake and toast 'em, fry and roast ‚Äôem till beards blaze, and eyes glaze, till hair smells and skins crack, fat melts, and bones black in cinders lie beneath the sky! So dwarves shall die, and light the night for our delight, Ya hey! Ya-harri-hey! Ya hoy!
Under the mountain dark and tall
Under the Mountain dark and tall, The King has come unto his hall! His foe is dead, the Worm of Dread, And ever so his foes shall fall.
Sing all ye joyful!
Sing all ye joyful, now sing all together! The wind's in the tree-top, the wind's in the heather. The stars are in blossom, the moon is in flower, And bright are the windows of Night in her tower.
The Road Goes Ever On

The Road goes ever on and on Out from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, Let others follow it who can! Let them a journey new begin, But I at last with weary feet Will turn towards the lighted inn, My evening-rest and sleep to meet.
GROND! GROND! GROND!
GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND! GROND!
Katmuda

Katmuda! Gorosh!

Katmuda! Gorosh!

Katmuda! Gorosh chadar.
Houses of Healing
With a sigh you turn away, With a deepening heart, No more words to say, You will find that the world, Has changed forever. And the trees are now turning, From green to gol,
column3: And the sun is now fading, I wish I could hold you closer

column2: The Green Dragon
Oh you can search far and wide
column3: You can drink the whole town dry
column4: But you'll never find a beer so brown
column5: As the one we drink in our hometown. You can drink your fancy ales
column6: You can drink them by the flagon
column7: But the only brew for the brave and true... Comes from the Green Dragon!

column2: Naughty little fly
Naughty little fly. Why does he cry? Caught in a web. Soon you'll be... eaten.
Where there's a whip
Where there's a whip, there's a way. Where there's a whip, there's a way. We don't wanna go to war today
column3: But the Lord of the Lash says: "nay, nay, nay!"
column4: We're gonna march all day, all day, all day! Where there's a whip there's a way!

column2: O! What are you doing?
O! What are you doing, And where are you going? Your ponies need shoeing! The river is flowing! O! tra-la-la-lally here down in the valley!
The Dragon is Withered

The dragon is withered, His bones are now crumbled, His armour is shivered, His splendour is humbled! Though sword shall be rusted, And throne and crown perish With strength that men trusted And wealth that they cherish, Here grass is still growing, And leaves are yet swinging, The white water flowing, And elves are yet singing - Come! Tra-la-la-lally! Come back to the valley!
The King beneath the mountains

The King beneath the mountains, The King of carven stone, The lord of silver fountains Shall come into his own! His crown shall be upholden, His harp shall be restrung, His halls shall echo golden To songs of yore re-sung. The woods shall wave on mountains And grass beneath the sun, His wealth shall flow in fountains And the rivers golden run. The streams shall run in gladness, The lakes shall shine and burn, All sorrow fail and sadness At the Mountain-king's return!
Roll roll roll roll
Down the swift dark stream you go, Back to lands you once did know! Leave the halls and caverns deep, Leave the northern mountains steep, Where the forest wide and dim Stoops in shadow grey and grim!
Old fat spider spinning in a tree!
Old fat spider spinning in a tree! Old fat spider can't see me! Attercop! Attercop! Won't you stop, Stop your spinning and look for me?
The wind was on the withered heath

The wind was on the withered heath, but in the forest stirred no leaf: there shadows lay by night and day, and dark things silent crept beneath. The wind came down from mountains cold, and like a tide it roared and rolled, the branches groaned, the forest moaned, and leaves were laid upon the mould. The wind went on from West to East, all movement in the forest ceased, but shrill and harsh across the marsh its whistling voices were released. The grasses hissed, their tassels bent, the reeds were rattling‚Äîon it went o'er shaken pool under heavens cool where racing clouds were torn and rent. It passed the lonely Mountain bare and swept above the dragon's lair: there black and dark lay boulders stark and flying smoke was in the air. It left the world and took its flight over the wide seas of the night. The moon set sail upon the gale, and stars were fanned to leaping light.
Revalation of the Ringwaiths
We deny our maker. We cling to the darkness. We grasp for ourselves power and glory. Now we come, the Nine, Lords of Eternal Life.
Lament of Avor Taul

In the gleaming moonlight In a vale so fair East beyond Nahald Kudan And the Hermits there In secluded valley Secure and safe from harm Lay the city of Avor Taul A place of beauty and charm The mines of Avor Taul iron bore Yet they deeper delved They found beneath the mountains root A vein of mithril Long did it prosper Ere the mines did thrive Yet when the shadow lengthened Avor Taul could not survive Dark was the day Black was the night When the Shadow came Quenching the light When the Shadow came Quenching the light Although they were outnumbered They fought the Orc host fiercely The Dwarven warriors rallied The Orcs they slew profusely Three long months The battle raged The hope for rescue Began to fade\n\nThen came a trumpet blast at last A Dwarven army coming fast? Was this the rescue long delayed? The gate they rushed to open Was this the day for which they prayed? The gate they promptly opened Into the enemy hands they played The trumpet it was stolen The enemy armies forward rushed The Dwarven army Almost crushed And when the sun the mountains brushed Over the valley lay a hush Avor Taul lay in ruins Although from greedy orcin eyes The mines they remained hidden The Dwarven town of Avor Taul Was never after lived in Dwarven refugees did run To western keeps they fled And so it is under the sun Of Avor Taul it's said The Dwarf that first Lays eyes again On the ruins of Avor Taul Will fain to stay And make a way For the mines to be reclaimed To return Avor Taul to fame
Song of Durin

The world was young, the mountains green, No stain yet on the Moon was seen, No words were laid on stream or stone, When Durin woke and walked alone. He named the nameless hills and dells, He drank from yet untasted wells, He stooped and looked in Mirrormere, And saw a crown of stars appear, As gems upon a silver thread, Above the shadow of his head.
Ioreth's song

On winds and waters may you cross, See mountains white and blue. But on your road, let's not forget, The love I have for you Dance on beaches in Anfalas, Sleep in moonlit fields of view, May you cross another golden age, With preciousness free-flowing, With Halfling, Elves, and Dwarves engage, Their wisdom on you bestowing.
Fires of War

Stone by stone... Cracked, crushed, fallen... Beauty burned, erased... But not forgotten... I‚Äôll take your melodies... May your last breath... Fill the air with embers... I... inhale. In their blood, I will stand! Let the waning light of Man, Cast my shadow on the Fires of War, Till our time burns away, Till our embers fade to grey, Cast my shadow on the Fires of War!
